alert.note: Alert for Erie; Holmes; Huron; Lorain; Mahoning; Medina; Portage; Stark; Summit; Trumbull; Wayne (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 23 at 8:25PM EST until December 24 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills occurring. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Winter Storm Warning, blowing snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Ohio. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing snow may continue to reduce visibility to less than one mile. Overnight tonight through Sunday there will be an extended period of temperatures in the single digits. This combined with the strong winds would allow for a long period of wind chills well below zero. Temperatures this cold for an extended period of time will impact infrastructure across the region with frozen pipes a concern.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
